website_summaries.verdict: An affordable but quality option if you're new to wooden bats and want to try one out.
pros: The thin handle and heavy barrel feel comfortable to hold
This design also produces little to no feedback in the handle when you land a hard hit, unlike most wooden bats
cons: The thinner-than-usual handle, while comfortable, throws off the weight distribution
This gives the bat a top-heavy feeling

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of the 31” for my 14 yr old. The bat is well balanced by roughly finished. The first lasted maybe 150 swings before it cracked on one side on the middle of the upper barrel. He broke the second broke after 2 hit balls the day after I ordered it. This one splintered in two pieces along the handle. The wood inside looks less dense than older Louisville Slugger ash bats made 20+ years ago. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Panther Jim

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: This really should be labeled as "display only". I wasn't expecting much for the price, but my 13 yo son destroyed it with only a couple buckets of balls. It completely deformed (flat) and is about to shatter. The "ash" wood is so soft there are indentations from baseball seams all over. Also, the weight was almost 5 ounces off, I mean c'mon...don't market this as an actual bat!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wood bat
customer_reviews.text: Best wood bat for the price. You can go buy wood bat in the mid to bottom 100’s or buy this one for $29. A bat is a bat. If your son makes it to the big leagues he will either be given bats by his agent or team will provide Louisville slugger.
customer_reviews.author: matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Bat, Small Rage
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. Both of the actual bats are solid, beautiful pieces - however, there was a label directly applied to each bat. Only one came off cleanly so now one of my bats has half a barcode and a lot of nasty goop left from the sticker's partial removal. It's a small thing but I have a personal vendetta against stickers that dont come off.
customer_reviews.author: MissObserver777

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bat, Finish Can Be Better
customer_reviews.text: Bat is really nice and the 32" length complements my 5'0" frame well. One thing that can be improved is the finish as some areas of the bat can be a little rough. I believe that with consistent use the bat will wear down smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: JanTra

customer_reviews.title: Great bat!
customer_reviews.text: I ended up with a bat that had really nice wood grain. This is slightly heavier than my other 32 inch ash bats, maybe because of the paint.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Great feel but wish it didn't break so easily
customer_reviews.text: Very nice feel / weight distribution and great looking. Unfortunately it broke a week after receiving after around 100 swings. I caught one off the tip of the bat and the handle completely cracked. I ordered another and will see if it breaks quickly again.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Madden

customer_reviews.title: Bat is well balanced. Feels good on the swing.
customer_reviews.text: My son is aging up next season and has to use a - 3 BBCOR. He's been using a - 5 and wanted to get a wood bat - 3 to practice with. He loves this bat. He says that because the balance is good, it feels lighter than his other bat even though it's heavier. He's hitting better than ever too. Fine with me. It's a great price. The only problem has been that the bats tip is hollowed out some, so if you hit that part of the bat, you could chip the wood.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM MICHAEL HARRIS

customer_reviews.title: Bat is too light, not a drop 3.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the 32"/29oz bat for my son (age 14). The bat I received weighs 25 oz. Have not used it yet, but pretty disappointed that the weight is so far off. Also the bottom of the handle feels very rough, and the edges around the cup are very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Something to keep by the door
customer_reviews.text: A nice heavy bat. I got it to keep by the door because you never know. Maybe I’ll get to play ball with it as well.
customer_reviews.author: M. Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Bought for home defense for a girl who's anti-gun
customer_reviews.text: Has made my not gun friendly daughter happy since now she has something that makes her feel a little safer. Did it's job.
customer_reviews.author: maelstromjammer

customer_reviews.title: It’s pretty. 😁👍
customer_reviews.text: What an absolutely gorgeous piece of art! Bat is in flawless condition and delivery was perfect. Earlier than expected!
customer_reviews.author: Tim S.

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Product came brand new exactly as described. The paint will chip away gradually as you use it, but I think that should be expected since it is a wooden bat. It looks very nice upon first look right out of the box. I’m satisfied with the quality and price. Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Dean Renner

customer_reviews.title: The annoying sticker...
customer_reviews.text: There's a sticker with the bar code or something, I took it off but there is still sticky residue left on my bat :( anything else is great but it's a bit heavy in my opinion and I'm a short person.
customer_reviews.author: jeonkookookookook

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware
customer_reviews.text: Broke on first contact, first pitch —fastball inside corner. Not saying ALL these bats will be like that, but, I think these are culled duds.
customer_reviews.author: B. Davies

customer_reviews.title: Nice bat.
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice bat, but like some other reviews the weight is slightly off. Matters not for us though. It's used as a nice practice bat in preparation for an all wood bat league. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton

customer_reviews.title: Split it on my first outing!
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, but I snapped it on my 178th pitch in the batting cage, so maybe 140-some hits. I'm going to order 2 more and hope to get more out of them. I subtracted a star since I snapped it on my first outing.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: dope bat. Keep it for home security. Better grip when taped.
customer_reviews.author: SpicyTuna

customer_reviews.title: Great for protection
customer_reviews.text: Great smaller bat to keep by our bedside for protection, easy to use since it's compact.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with purchase. Bat has a solid feel and an amazing finish.
customer_reviews.author: LionHeart

customer_reviews.title: Love this bat
customer_reviews.text: Love this bat, a lot cheaper than a corndog and does just as good in my opinion. Good self defense weapon to have in the truck as well.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Good bat, Thinner than what i would have thought
customer_reviews.text: Good bat,Thinner than what i would have thought, But good.
customer_reviews.author: Drake

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant bat
customer_reviews.text: I like this bat. It's nice looking. I don't use it for baseball, though, mostly just fidget with it while I'm on conference calls.
customer_reviews.author: DAR

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for the $
customer_reviews.text: As described, weight, length, nailed it in the description. Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Sumner

customer_reviews.title: Broke on 7 Swings off the Tee
customer_reviews.text: This bat broke after less than ten swings of balls on a tee! Forget about an inside two-seamer — this bat splintered on my seventh swing off the tee. Save yourself the money and the disappointment. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Karla Vanassche

customer_reviews.title: It works great, and is still in tact
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 16 year old son to use in his first high school wood bat tournament. It works great, and is still in tact.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Zumwalt

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son, and he love it..he is 15 and right away he hit a very nice line through center field..very powerfull.. the bat didnt break or anything ..it feels robust
customer_reviews.author: yei 180

customer_reviews.title: Cupped end. Cupped end not shown in picture nor is it mentioned. Not a real baseball bat.
customer_reviews.text: Simply don't buy this facade of a baseball bat. A t-ball mentality has resulted in this extremely sub-par product. They made me give it one star.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W. Gaskill

customer_reviews.title: It has a Cupped Tip
customer_reviews.text: It has a cupped tip and the handle feels very thin, so thin, it feels like it might break at the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Strietelmeier

customer_reviews.title: Ordered the 33/30oz and like others have said
customer_reviews.text: Ordered the 33/30oz and like others have said, the weight was way off. Only weighs about 26oz. Disappointed as the plan was to use for weighted bat drills.
customer_reviews.author: LRBouf

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good bat good quality still using it after one season
customer_reviews.author: Russell Rachubinski

customer_reviews.title: Weak wood
customer_reviews.text: Nice bat end loaded. However mine broke on only the THIRD swing the first time I made contact with a ball it snapped
customer_reviews.author: Mat pij

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a wood bat
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a wood bat. We all know the dangers of buying a wood bat, one swing and it break. Took batting practice today and was great for the price. Would not use in a game but for a practice bat you can't beat the price. Will purchase more expensive maple bat for the real games.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph carola

customer_reviews.title: Defective bat
customer_reviews.text: We ordered a 33” / 30 oz. bat, but is was clearly lighter compared to a similar model 29 oz. bat. Also, it cracked and broke within a week of using it for batting practice.
customer_reviews.author: James Barfield

customer_reviews.title: I dig it
customer_reviews.text: It has a nice weight to it and the black finish is rad
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weight is WAAAAAY off
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 32" bat that is supposed to be 29 ounces. I placed it on a postal scale and it is only 25 ounces. Poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: RKF

customer_reviews.title: Great bat!
customer_reviews.text: Great bat for the price, My 15 year old used to play in a wooden bat league!
customer_reviews.author: robert pattison

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely no durability.
customer_reviews.text: The bat broke on my fourth ever swing... I will not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great bat for batting practice, a little on the heavier side, but gets you ready for game pitching!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kocienski

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: My 14 yo son loved it! Great quality and perfect size and weight
customer_reviews.author: MrsBronko

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Would give it a zero if I could. Broke during batting practice first time using it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: It was very light. Being so light felt weird to me. It broke in a week and a half. I don’t recommend it for highs school players.
customer_reviews.author: Zayyir

customer_reviews.title: Beware: great for display case, but that’s about it.
customer_reviews.text: Should’ve read more reviews. Snapped in half batting balls around the beach, no more than 30 hits.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: perfect size
customer_reviews.text: It was the perfect size for the purpose I bought it for..
customer_reviews.author: Chrisy

customer_reviews.title: Broke easily
customer_reviews.text: Broke after less than 100 swings at 73 mph. It’s cheap for a reason.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy N.

customer_reviews.title: And for that it is a good bat. Can not say in game if it ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought for training only. And for that it is a good bat . Can not say in game if it would hold up but just for off season training I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 13 year old son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 13 y/o and he's very pleased, and so was I at the price!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Browning

customer_reviews.title: i figured that i should buy something a little less lethal than my 9mm for situations like that. it lost a star because the grain ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this bat after i caught someone trying to break into my car. i figured that i should buy something a little less lethal than my 9mm for situations like that. it lost a star because the grain seemed kind of rough, but it does its job
customer_reviews.author: kelso

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It is a lot ligjter than Mable and it's easier to swing
customer_reviews.author: Tanner

customer_reviews.title: Broken.
customer_reviews.text: Had a giant crack right down the middle when I got it. Almost in half.
customer_reviews.author: Jess Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Broke the very first practice
customer_reviews.text: Looks and feels great. Unfortunately it broke within a dozen contacts at the cages. Probably made contact with the handle, but certainly didn't expect this to break so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal!
customer_reviews.text: Great value. Great bat. Just wish they didn't put the Barcode sticker directly on the bat - left a sticky square behind after removal - just a slight bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Jon & Julia

customer_reviews.title: *Knock Knock* Who's there? Bat! Bat Who? Bat you'll never guess!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this hits baseballs quite well; however, it sits beside my bed and offers its security services instead.
customer_reviews.author: G.O.A.T.

customer_reviews.title: Good bat
customer_reviews.text: Don't forget the grip tape to go on the handle. Nice piece of wood.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Broke Immediately
customer_reviews.text: This broke on my first at bat. I may have just gotten a bad cut of wood, but I would not recommend buying this! Very very cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weak wood
customer_reviews.text: Bat split during its first and only use. If you have a power hitter, do not go with ash wood.
customer_reviews.author: Karen brunner

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in the quality
customer_reviews.text: This item broke the first day it was used. My son hit approximately 55 baseballs off a pitching machine and the bat split. Very disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I got a replacement bat as the first one split. The replacement bat cracked the first time using hit. I wouldn't order this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for home defense. I can tell that this is a very cheap bat that wouldn't last if you wanted to take it out for a sport.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy It
customer_reviews.text: Piece of crap. Broke after 5-7 hits in batting cage. Called Louisville slugger and they told me they don't warrantee wood bats. It wasn't the most expensive bat in the world but c'mon. 7 balls hit and it cracks like it did? DONT BUY IT
customer_reviews.author: Kellbone

product_meta.title: Louisville Slugger Genuine Series 3X Ash Mixed Baseball Bat
product_meta.description: Louisville SluggerA GenuineA MixedA AshA Wood Bat (Natural/Regular)The Louisville Slugger GenuineA mixedA ash wood batA has been pulled from the original production line for some minor flaw that will not affect the bat's performance. These small production errors meansA a great dealA on a superior bat ideal for practice, batting cages or even games.Features: * Ash is a lighter, more flexible timber that offers a more forgiving sweet spot and less breakage * Finish: Natural/Regular * Turning Model: Mixed * Weight: (-1) to (-3) oz. drop (weight can vary depending on wood density)
